# HTA+

> HTA+ (Health Technology Advisory) is an independent healthcare technology advisory firm based in Nigeria. We help healthcare organizations, startups, and public institutions across Africa make better technology decisions â€” from strategy through implementation.

## About

HTA+ is a boutique advisory firm founded by Bernard Fatoye, specializing in healthcare technology advisory and management. We are vendor-neutral and focused on outcomes, not selling software. Our expertise spans digital health readiness, interoperability, health information systems, and capacity building across Nigerian and African health systems.

## Services

- [Digital Health Readiness Assessment](https://htaplus.com/services/assessment.html): Structured, vendor-neutral evaluation of whether a facility, program, or government health initiative is prepared for digital health investments. Covers governance, infrastructure, clinical workflows, interoperability, data quality, workforce readiness, financial sustainability, and measurement. Typical engagement: 2-6 weeks.
- [Training & Competency Development](https://htaplus.com/services/training.html): Assessment-driven, role-based training customized to real operational gaps. Covers digital health governance, workflow optimization, data quality, interoperability readiness, workforce digital readiness, financial sustainability, and data use for decision-making.
- Strategy & Policy Advisory: Market positioning, growth roadmaps, and policy guidance that align technology choices with regulatory realities and stakeholder needs.
- Implementation & Management: Hands-on delivery support translating strategy into operations, with governance structures and performance tracking.

## Expertise Areas

- Digital health readiness assessment
- Health information exchange and interoperability (FHIR, DHIS2, HL7)
- EMR/HIS evaluation and implementation oversight
- Healthcare technology strategy for African markets
- Vendor-neutral technology advisory
- Health data governance and quality
- Change management for digital health adoption
- Capacity building for health tech teams
